data.test_name: Some Basic Concepts of Chemistry Test - 2

1.q_string: One micrometer stands for:
How many tons of \(Z n\) can be obtained form \(10\) tons of \(Z n S\) ?

\(1.2 gm\) of carbon is burnt completely in oxygen (limited supply) to produce \(CO\) and \(CO _{2}\). This mixture of gases is treated with solid \(I _{2} O _{5}\) (to know the amount of \(CO\) produced), the liberated iodine required \(120 ml\) of \(0.1 M\) hypo solution for complete titration. The percentage of carbon converted into \(CO\) is:
If \(6.3 g\) of \(NaHCO _{3}\) are added to \(15.0 g\) of \(CH _{3} COOH\) solution, the residue is found to weigh \(18.0 g\). The mass of \(CO _{2}\) released in the reaction is:
Ammonia \(\left( NH _{3}\right)\) obtained from different sources always has same proportion of Nitrogen and Hydrogen. It proves the validity of law of:
Which one of the following sets of compounds correctly illustrate the law of reciprocal proportions?
The ratio between the volumes of the gaseous reactant and the gaseous products can be expressed in simple whole numbers. This law is known as:
The mass of \(2.6\) moles of sulphur dioxide is:
If in a reaction, \(HNO_3\) is reduced to \(NO\), the mass of \(HNO_3\) absorbing one mole of electrons would be:

When burnt in air, \(14.0 g\) mixture of carbon and sulphur gives a mixture of \(CO _{2}\) and \(SO _{2}\) in the volume ratio of \(2: 1\), volume being measured at the same conditions of temperature and pressure. Moles of carbon in the mixture is:
A compound contains \(38.8 \% C , 16.0 \% H\) and \(45.2 \% N\). The formula of the compound would be:
The approximate number of molecules in one litre of water is :

Certain non-metal X forms two oxides \(I\) and \(II\). The mass percentage of oxygen in \(I \left( X _{4} O _{6}\right)\) is \(43.7\) which is same as that \(X\) in the \(II\) oxide. Find the formula of \(II\) oxide.
On reduction with hydrogen, \(3.6 g\) of an oxide of metal left \(3.2 g\) of metal. If the vapour density metal is \(32\) , the simplest formula of the oxide would be:

\(0.4 gm\) of an organic compound was treated according to Kjeldahl's method. The ammonia evolved was absorbed in \(50 ml\) of \(0.5 M H _{3} PO _{3}\). The residual acid required \(30 ml\) of \(0.5 MCa ( OH )_{2}\). Find the percentage of \(N _{2}\) in the compound.

Balance the following skeletal equation:

\(As _{2} O _{3}+ SnCl _{2}+ HCl \rightarrow SnCl _{4}+ As + H _{2} O\)
The volume of oxygen necessary for the complete combustion of \(20 L\) of propane is:
Volume of \(CO _{2}\) obtained at STP by the complete decomposition of \(9.85 gm\), \(BaCO _{3}\) is:
A gas mixture contains \(50 \%\) helium and \(50 \%\) methane by volume. What is the percentage by mass of methane in the mixture?

\(3 g\) of activated charcoal was added to \(50 mL\) of acetic acid solution ( \(0.06 N )\) in a flask. After an hour it was filtered and the strength of the filtrate was found to be \(0.042 N\). The amount of acetic acid absorbed (per gram of charcoal) is:
Chemistry does not play a major role in:
q_option: Large scale production of a variety of fertilizers
Design and synthesis new materials having specific magnetic, electric and optical properties

1.q_string: A solid mixture (\(4.69g\)) consisting of lead nitrate and sodium nitrate was heated below \(600^{\circ} C\) until the mass of the residue was constant. If the loss in mass is \(28 \%\) then the mass of lead nitrate in the mixture was (in grams):
\(0.50 g\) of a mixture of \(K _{2} CO _{3}\) and \(Li _{2} CO _{3}\) required \(30 mL\) of \(0.25 N\), \(HCl\) solution for neutralization. What is \% composition of \(Li _{2} CO _{3}\) ?

\(32 g\) of a sample of \(FeSO S _{4} \cdot 7 H _{2} O\) where the dissolved in dilute Sulphuric acid and water and it's volume was made up to 1 litre, \(25 mL\) of this solution required \(20 mL\) of \(0.02 M KMnO _{4}\) solution of complete oxidation. Calculate the weight \% of \(FeSO _{4} \cdot 7 H _{2} O\) in the sample.

What percent of a sample of nitrogen must be allowed to escape if its temperature, pressure, and volume are to be changed from \(220^{\circ} C , 3 atm\) and \(1.65\) litre to \(110^{\circ} C, 0.7\) atm and \(1.00\) litre respectively?

\(1.575 g\) of oxalic acid \(( COOH )_{2} . xH _{2} O\) are dissolved in water and the volume made upto \(250 ml\). On titration \(16.68\) gm of this solution requires \(25 ml\) of \(\frac{N}{15} NaOH\) solution for complete neutralization. Calculate \(x\).

What mass of \(AgI\) will dissolve in \(1.0 L\) of \(1.0 M NH _{3}\) ? neglect change in conc. of \(NH _{3}\)

(Given : \(K_{s p}=1.5 \times 10^{-16} ; K_{f}\left[A g\left( NH _{3}\right)_{2}^{+}\right]\)(At.mass \(Ag =108, I=127\) )
\(0.2 g\) of an organic compound contains \(C, H, O\) on combustion, it yields \(0.15 g\) of \(CO _{2}\) and \(0.12 g H _{2} O\). The percentage of \(C , H\) and \(O\) respectively is:

\(2 g\) of brass containing \(Cu\) and \(Zn\) only reacts with \(3 M HNO _{3}\) solution. Following are the reactions taking place.

\(Cu (s)+ HNO _{3}(a q) \rightarrow Cu ^{2+}(a q)+ NO _{2}(g)+ H _{2} O (l)\)

\(Zn (s)+ H ^{+}(a q)+ NO _{3}^{-}(a q) \rightarrow NH _{4}^{+}(a q)+ Zn ^{2+}(a q)+ H _{2} O (l)\)

The liberated \(NO _{2}( g )\) was found to be \(1.04 L\) at \(25^{\circ} C\) and \(1 atm [ Cu =\) \(63.5, Z n=65.4]\)

How many grams of \(NH _{4} NO _{3}\) will be obtained in the reaction?

Calculate the mass percent \(( w / w )\) of sulphuric acid in a solution prepared by dissolving \(4 g\) of sulphur trioxide in a \(100 ml\) sulphuric acid solution containing 80 mass percent (w/w) of \(H _{2} SO _{4}\) and having a density of \(1.96 g / ml\) (molecular weight of \(H _{2} SO _{4}=98\) ) Take reaction \(SO _{3}+\) \(H _{2} O \rightarrow H _{2} SO _{4}\).
